page.title: 05COMMUNITY ISSUES: WASHINGTON
page.content: {Employment}is an important concern. The majority of{unemployed}are aged 17/24, mostly school leavers. Many visit the Job Centre where about 300 jobs are available at any one time but only about 16 are accepted. Most of the employed are manual workers, aged 25/35. Another important issue is the welfare of the{elderly.} Rosebery Court and Peacehaven Court provide {sheltered housing}for the elderly. Donwell House,{old people's home, houses 50/60 homeless, handicapped or lonely people, aged 50/100+. Doors are locked to prevent the less stable wandering off but visits to clubs and bingo are arranged. There is also some concern about proposals to move{VI formers}from schools to{Tertiary Colleges}in the Sunderland area.
